moving

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • moving.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Game
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The game. Takes care of all updates and all components of the game, and draws the game. Essentially a manager for the game, even though the Main class is the one that initializes the program.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    java.io.File saveFile,

        Parameters:

        saveFile - The File to which player save data will be saved.
        playerName - The player's name.

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws all elements of the game. Although most calculations are carried out in the updateGame() and updateMenu() methods, some calculations must be carried out in this method, too.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - The object on which the graphics is drawn.

      • drawMiniMap

        public void drawMiniMap(java.awt.Graphics g,
               int mapX,
               int mapY,
               int edgeSize)
        Draws the mini-map for the game. NOTE: THIS METHOD IS NOT USED IN OUR GAME. We initially were going to have a mini-map in the top right corner, which would show were you were in a "big picture" with respect to the rest of the map, but this didn't fit with our game style. We decided to leave the method in, just for information.
        Parameters:
        g - The object on which the graphics is drawn.
        mapX - The x location where the map will be drawn.
        mapY - The y location where the map will be drawn.
        edgeSize - The edge size of the map; i.e. the scale to which the map will be drawn. (e.g. 100 would mean a 100x100 square)

      • updateGame

        public void updateGame()
        Updates the game and all of its components.

      • updateMenu

        public void updateMenu()
        Updates the menu, if the player is in the menu.

      • menuSwitch

        public void menuSwitch()
        Switches from game to menu or menu to game. Handles which buttons to put on the screen.

      • readMap

        public void readMap()
        This method is used for custom input for map reading. In "admin mode", you could press 'I' to call this message and import any map you wanted. In the actual game, this is disabled, to prevent players from teleporting anywhere they wanted.

      • export

        public void export(java.io.File f)
        Exports the map. Although we don't edit most of the map file, we must edit the Treasure Chests because once a player opens a treasure chest and receives the item it had, we don't want the player to be able to reload the map and acquire an infinite amount of items. Thus, we edit the treasure chests and make them permanently opened.
        Parameters:
        f - The file to export the map to.

      • readMap

        public void readMap(java.lang.String map)
        Loads a map from the indicated map file.
        Parameters:
        map - A String that is the name of the map file.

      • potionGet

        public void potionGet(PotionJar p)
        Heals the player based on the given potion jar.
        Parameters:
        p - The potion jar to get the health/energy from.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame()
        Saves the game.

      • addEnemy

        public void addEnemy(java.lang.String s)
        Adds an enemy to the map at the mouse's position. This was intended to be used as a testing mechanism. In "admin mode" you could access this method by pressing '6', but this is disabled in the actual game.
        Parameters:
        s - The name of the enemy. Used to put the correct enemy in the map.

      • addEnemy

        public void addEnemy(java.lang.String s,
            int x,
            int y,
            java.util.HashMap<Item,java.lang.Double> drops,
            java.awt.Image img)
        This method adds an enemy to the game. This method is used when loading a map, so the correct enemies can be loaded into the correct locations on the map.
        Parameters:
        s - The name of the enemy.
        x - The x-location to put the enemy.
        y - The y-location to put the enemy.
        drops - A HashMap representing the drops of this enemy (see the Enemy class for more info).
        img - The enemy's image.
